name: Disney's Pop Century Resort

reviews.text: First I would like to say thank you to all of those who posted reviews. I did check regularly before our trip and the information I learned was most valuable. The magical express worked perfectly. Traveled with wife, 8 yr daugher, and 5 yr son. Had seven bags and never had to touch them. We arrived at airport at 9:30 PM. Walked right onto bus, check in was less than 5 minutes, changed into swim suits, took a late night swim, went for for a snack, and returned to room around midnight and all of our bags were there. Great on check out as well. Got luggage cart from front, checked in bags, and did not touch them again until baggage claim at Cleveland Airport. Hotel staff was great. Every person was very pleasant. Took advantage of tip envelopes per day for housekeeping, upon return to room would find balloon animals, towel animals, scenes with kids toys, house keeping even let me borrow a computer cable for lap top without having to rent one. Hotel grounds always very clean. Icons are larger than life. We were on Disney Dining Plan, awsome idea. Saved a lot of money. Just our dinners averaged about $150 per night. I would guess that we saved between 500 and 750 dollars. Thanks for everyone who suggested to make reservations asap. We ate everywhere we wanted. The Royal Dinner in the Castle is so magical. We found the bus transportation worked fine. Never more than a 15 min wait. Magic hours are a plus. We stayed late in parks every night. I also want to thank those who suggested you fax hotel before you go with your room request. We did so and got room in the 50's section lakeside. It was quiet and every morning we had ducks, bunnies, or cranes to greet us in the morning. I can say it truely was a magical vacation and the tips found on these pages helped a lot.
reviews.title: Fantastic Trip

likes.disliked: — Fax in room requests 3 to 4 days before check in

reviews.title: wont go back
reviews.text: we have stayed at many disney hotels. The pop century is the worst. The food is served cold with limited choices. The shuttle buses do not run enough so wait s are often long. The staff is not pleasant at all. We stayed in a room near the pool which was supposed to close at midnight. We were awakened each night at 2 A.M to screaming people. When we called to complain we were told that they dont really enforce that rule. We have seen a decline in the quality overall at Disney. They have grown away from Walt Disneys dream of a magical place where families can gather. When they decide to charge almost $3.00 for a small muffin at breakfast then something is very wrong.

reviews.title: It was ok, for budget minded people.
reviews.text: We stayed at Pop in June of 2006. At first we were so excited with all the bright bold colors and the neat retro style it had outside. The rooms were very small, not enough towels for four people, had to keep taking some off of the carts, floor was all sticky from something spilled by previous guests. The lines at the food court were very long if you went at peak time. The refillable mug was a great value. Parking was inconvenient. At night we had to park far away from our hotel. Buses to take you to other parks were a reasonable wait and drivers were all friendly. This is a resort for people that are on a budget and do not plan to stay at the hotel resort for the day instead of going to the parks. We figured that being we weren't going to spend any length of time at this resort, it was ok for the price. We started off with this hotel being it was the cheapest, and we got what we paid for. THOUGH, the staff was friendly and someone at the hotel actually sent a photo birthday card of Mickey to my husband with balloons. I don't know how they knew, because we never told them. That was a real surprise! By the way, we never saw Mickey the entire time we were at Disney World for a week and a half.

This was my third trip to Disney and the first time I stayed in a Disney resort. It was great! The room was clean and the staff was very nice. We stayed in the back of the resort in the 1960's building overlooking a lake with a beautiful walkway around it. The resort was nicely landscaped and had 3 large pools. There is also a big gift shop and restaurant on site. Transportation is provided to all the parks, we never got in our car until it was time to go home! This is a wonderful place to stay for familes.
reviews.title: Disney Resort For Those On A Budget

reviews.text: We just visited Disney 6/23-6/30/06. I have a family of 4, 2 sons ages 14 and 11. Our last trip to Disney was the summer of 2000. On our last trip we stayed at All Star Sports which was great so I was all for staying at a value hotel again and knowing this hotel is pretty new I thought we couldnt go wrong. I must say Im glad I read a few reviews as they were very helpful. Let me start by saying we were very pleased with our stay, the value hotels are perfect for a family on a budget. The rooms are spotless, and there is plenty of room for luggage and getting around with 4 in a room. So what was different this time....Pop Century is a RESORT and that means it is huge in comparison to the other 3 value hotels. I absolutly loved the walking path along the lake and the bridge. I do believe I took more pictures of the wildlife than anything at Disney. We woke to birds, rabbits on the lawn, ducks and herons sitting by or in the lake and there are huge turtles near the bridge, however getting around can pose a problem. There is no dout you want to be in building 4 or 5 which is the edge of the 50's into the 60's. If you are on the inside of the buildings you face the hippy dippy pool, if on the outside either another buildings or the lake. This is where you find the main building...food court and buses! I think no matter what building, parking is terrible.If you drive you will want to minimize trips to the car, its a good hike for most..Buses, no problem usually on in 10+ mins. We were lucky and never stood. Food court, in an earlier review it was stated there was nothing healthy there, let me correct that person....everyday I saw fresh fruit, in the cooler there were grapes and cut up fruit. I purchased a salad twice. there was milk and yougurt as well. I didnt say those items were cheap. Overall the food court is reasonable, about 10-20% higher than what most of us pay at home. EX: Burger/fries $6.50. The food court stays pretty busy but there was always plenty of seats. All the pools only go to like 3 1/2 feet which is fine for me. They have beach balls and such to play with and there were even life jackets for smaller children to use. Overall the service was good, hotel is a great value for a clean up to date room. The grounds are bright and funky in style and theme. If you are used to staying in $400.00 a night rooms this is not the place for you, however if you are a family who like a nice average room that is clean in a very tacky fun environment...I say book!!
reviews.title: Disney does it like no other
I loved the theme
reviews.text: We stayed in the 50's section. We got all the benefits for staying on Disney property for a lot less money! Everybody was very friendly. The rooms aren't real big, but how much time do you really spend in your hotel room when you're at Disneyworld? The room space was no problem for us. My husband & I were in one room & our son & daughter-in-law were another. We couldn't get right next to each other, but they tried to get us as close as possible. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: Loved my stay at the Pop Century!!
reviews.text: Just got back from staying at the Pop Century May 27-30, 2004 was very impressed w/ the resort. Loved the way the resort looked very clean. My family and I stayed in the 60's building and was very close to the pool and food court. Took the Disney buses to the theme parks. The buses came about every 15 min. Saves $ on parking and gas. Looking forward to staying at the Pop Century for my next Disney trip.

reviews.title: Loved Pop Century
reviews.text: I just returned from a five day stay at the Pop Century (5/17 - 5/21) and I have to stay that it was a great place to stay. Like most people who are likely to be reading this, I was constantly checking various web sites for opinions to see what we could expect. After reading the negative stuff like the room is too small, too hot, and the place is cheap, I must admit I was apprehensive in thinking I had booked the right place for me, my wife, and 4 year old daughter. But once I was there, I have to go out on a limb and say that those that did complain are likely those types of people that are unaccustomed to the plebeian lifestyle.

We stayed in the 1960's building and rooms are bright, clean, and provide the utility that you need in a room. No complaints here. Housekeeping was attentive and helpful. The facility itself was clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Well worth the price
Cant wait to get back
reviews.text: The pool was perfect and free life jackets were offered for the less developed swimmers (at no cost). This let my daughter go into the deeper water without fear. Good forthought on the Disney planners.

reviews.title: Good Value Good Service
reviews.text: Disney's Pop Century Resort was great. My wife and I both thoroughly enjoyed our 9 day trip at the resort. We payed $50 a night to stay, which I think is one of the cheapest in the area. We got a lot of bang for our buck.

reviews.title: Much better than expected
reviews.text: The service was great, happy, friendly people, the rooms were clean, housekeeping made up the room nicely and the food court had a nice assortment of food. It's true you will get tired of the food if you are there for a while, but who wants to eat at one place for their whole trip? Beautiful view out our window at the Hourglass Lake located West of the 70's area.

reviews.title: Loved Pop Century
reviews.text: The bus transportation may seem to the average traveler as long, but these Disney buses are taking care of hundreds of resorts and 6 parks. I didn't think one bus every 10 minutes was too much to wait.

reviews.title: Great Disney Resort.. As usual!!
reviews.text: All in all, I would definetely stay at the Pop Century Resort again if I was traveling on a budget. In my opinion it was a 5-star budget resort!

reviews.title: Tiny rooms, terrible food, interesting decor
reviews.text: When I first booked our trip on short notice, all our resort choices were full including all the moderate and deluxe hotels , so we decided to give the Pop Century Resort a shot. We had never stayed at a value resort hotel before so I was skeptical. My daughter went online to view the hotel exterior and rooms, and by the pictures we decided that this resort was a little too loud and the rooms looked kind of crammed. When we arrived however I went to check in, while my husband and daughter had their doubts.

My friend and I were heading to Florida for a wedding so we decided to make a Disney trip out of it since we were already going to be down there. We wanted to stay for 6 nights and knew how expensive Disney property can be. Our first preference was to stay at the Caribbean Beach but when our third friend cancelled the prices went up and we had to downgrade.
reviews.title: Met the needs of a budget traveler

likes.liked: — Being on Disney property is always a good thing.

reviews.text: Pop Century was fine and it met our basic needs. We were just excited to being staying anywhere on property. Check in was busy but efficient. The staff was very friendly. We ordered a mini-fridge for our room and it was waiting for us 10 minutes later when we dropped off our bags. I was very surprised by that.
reviews.title: Great Place - Lots to See

reviews.text: Our room was in the 50's building and on the 3rd floor. We used the elevators for our luggage but other than that the stairs were closest. It was pretty amazing to see giant bowling pins as staircases but it went with the theme. We never used the Hippy-Dippy pool ourselves but it was very busy at all times. Luckily we paid for the cheapest room farthest from the pool so we didn't have to hear the screaming kids.
reviews.title: Love the Pop but.....

likes.disliked: — Minor repairs that should have been completed before the room was occupied.

reviews.text: As you have probably read on here before the rooms at PC are VERY small. We had two double beds and one of them was practically touching the door. There is no real closet but they do have an extra shelf and rack with hangers next to the sink that worked out just fine with the large dresser also in the room. I love that all Disney sinks are on the outside of the bathroom as well. It makes things much easier when vacationers are in a hurry to get ready. The bathroom itself was very small and the toilet was the loudest I've ever heard before. The temperature and pressure in the shower were great but the sink pressure was very light.
reviews.title: Groovy Setting...

likes.liked: — Transportation from and to airport and parks

reviews.text: Shopping and eating at the hotel food court was exactly what we expected. Yes, it is very busy but they have so many people working that we hardly had to wait. The food choices were pretty basic. I had the pancakes and they were pretty good. Because we were staying for a week we went to the grocery store before checking in and bought cereal and fruit to keep in our room. I bought a half gallon of milk at the cafeteria and it was under $5. The food there is very expensive but it is Disney and everyone expects that before leaving home. Paying $60 for a fridge was worth the cost of eating in the cafe every morning. Breakfast for 2 was over $20 and that didn't include a drink.
reviews.title: Fantastic, Loved it!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Pop Century for 3 nights in December. This was my first trip to Disney and everything was wonderful!
reviews.title: Would Stay Again!

reviews.text: The Magical Express was waiting for us as soon as we arrived at the airport at midnight. We got right on and the Pop Century was the first stop the Magical Express made. Check-in was smooth and we quickly got a room.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.text: We stayed in the 1950s building on the first floor. The room was small but we didn't spend much time in there anyways. There were 2 full beds that were firm and had comfy pillows and sheets. The bathroom was tiny but came with nice toiletries. The room also had a small table.
reviews.title: Loved Pop Century!!!!

reviews.text: The pool area was very clean and quiet. Unfortunately, we only got to go in the pool one day because we spent all our time at the parks!
reviews.title: Little touches set the tone for us!

likes.liked: — Friendly and accomodating staff every where we turned!
likes.disliked: — Pretty huge- room was far from the check-in desk....

reviews.text: The shuttles to the park came almost every 10 minutes and weren't too crowded. The ride was a short one anyways.
reviews.title: Great Disney Experience
Back Again - Still Enjoying
reviews.text: For the third time, our family of five enjoyed their stay at the Pop Century.

This year we stayed in the 60's building near the main pool which was more convenient than our prior rooms in the 50's building. Had two connecting rooms, which provides two bathrooms and ample space. The rooms are basic, but very clean.
reviews.title: Great Value, The Kids Loved it

reviews.text: We booked at the last moment and our rate was $125/room/night. While one can certainly get lower rates in Orlando - particularly at condos - we continue to believe that the extra is worthwhile to stay on the WDW grounds (please debate amongst your family). Bus service to the parks is convenient (even if they do take the slowest routes) and provides early entry and late evenings at the parks.
reviews.title: great disney value hotel

reviews.text: Recommended for those those with families.
reviews.title: We can't wait to go back

likes.disliked: — didn't do the family meal plan, my fault

reviews.text: We took the kids to Disney and did our best to pick a resort that the kids would like. We settled on Pop Century, which was great for what it is. The property is littered with giant pop culture icons like cell phones, rubick's cubes and jukeboxes. (Christopher had to ask me what a rubick's cube was). There are several pools (with one right outside our building) and the Disney transport system right outside the main building was awesome for getting to and from the parks.
reviews.title: An amazing long weekend!!

likes.disliked: — Nothing, I did my research and knew what to expect!

reviews.text: The Pop Century was about what I expected. The rooms were very small. The food was not very good. However, we were only there in the evenings and the pool was great. It is heated so even though the night was a little cool, the kids were still able to swim. The lifeguards seemed very good and watched the children closely in the water. The staff was courteous and check-in/check-out was not bad at all. We paid about $85/night for a room that would probably cost about $60/night were it not at Disney. The transportation from the hotel to the parks was good although the transportation out of the parks was a nightmare and Disney did not have the details worked out. We probably will not stay here again. As this was our 6th trip to Disney, we are about "Disney-ed out". We went from Dec. 6-Dec. 11 because this is supposedly "off-season". However, it was just as crowded as it has been everytime we have visited. The wait times for rides were not bad but we were expecting it to be a lot less crowded. If we do choose to return at some point, we will probably stay at one of the moderate resorts next time. We will definitely NOT do the dining plan again but that's another story....
reviews.title: About what I expected....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for an amazingly low price for the last 4 nights of our 15 night trip, to save a little money as we had been on a cruise!! We had stayed at Disney Moderates and one Deluxe previously and some off site hotels. I was quite worried about staying here but we loved it, and we are a couple around 60 years! We had a top floor room in the 60's building overlooking the lake - very peaceful. Housekeeping was good, and all the staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Pop Century, a pleasant surprise.

likes.liked: — Fun theming, friendly service, great value.
likes.disliked: — Disney bus service returning late from parks.

reviews.text: I can see that the theming could be overwhelming for some, but it fits in fine and we enjoyed looking around. We found the beds comfy but agree with a previous poster about the small sheets. This was the same at the Moderate resort we stayed at too! The low water pressure was ridiculous I have to say.
reviews.title: Some Tradeoffs to Consider Before Booking

likes.liked: — Perqs that come with staying at a Disney resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally the buses were very good apart from leaving the parks late when the system seemed unable to cope. I am sure there must be a better way of coping with the situation though. At least at the resort you wait in line and it is not just a free for all as at other resorts when the bus arrives.
reviews.title: Needs to be updated...

reviews.text: We ate a couple of times at the food court and thought it was fine for what it is meant for. I wouldn't want to eat there every day though. Disney coffee is horrible.
reviews.title: Great time at Disney and at Pop Century

likes.liked: — Close to parks and great price, it's part of Disney and it showed!
likes.disliked: — I thought it was great, no real complaints!

reviews.title: Had A Great Time At The Pop
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pop Century June 18-25. This was our first trip to Disney and with the negative reviews I was nervous but knew we wouldn't be spending a lot of time in the room. When I booked the room I requested a 50's room and it was ready when we got there around 11. It was very clean and close to everything. The rooms are on the small side but we didn't go to Disney to stay in the room.

It took us a few days to get used to the whole Disney transportation but by day 3 we had it down and was loving it. We did have a car but didn't use it-- we actually enjoyed not having to fight the traffic with the bus system(longest wait was 10 minutes to me Disney does an outstanding job with that).
reviews.title: Good value, enjoyed my star

reviews.text: We did do the meal plan which if you are going to do any sit down meals it pays for itself. We ate at several other hotels and while waiting for our table we'd check out the other resorts--after comparing the rooms we decided it just wasn't worth the extra money for a place to sleep and shower. We did eat lunch at the Pop the day we left and thought the food was fine. I have to say our favorite dinner was O'Hana's at the Polynesian.
reviews.title: Fun place to stay
Loved it!
reviews.text: The parks were crowded and it was hot but we really enjoyed ourselves. We are already looking at dates for next year and we will definitely stay at the Pop again.

reviews.title: Loved every minute of our stay at Pop Century
reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel for four nights, and quite enjoyed it. The rooms are specious (though the furniture's are simple and the choices of soap and shampoo given are very small (no creams or anything).

reviews.title: Basic - but who needs more when you're out all day!
reviews.text: We stayed for five days leading up to Christmas - our reason for staying on property this time was to take advantage of the 'Extra Magic Hours' (used to be called early entry but now run some evenings too) which meant we could access rides at quieter times when the parks were getting busy.

reviews.title: Pop - Simply Fantastic!!!
reviews.text: We used the 'Magical Express' to transfer from the airport which was great except that it took another three hours after check in for our luggage to be delivered to our room - as we'd arrived in the evening, we wanted to go to bed but had to wait up until this arrived.
Bus links to the park are fine - we stayed in the 80's block (great Roger Rabbit and computer swimming pool!) which was less than five minutes walk from the main building and transportation.
reviews.title: Disney Pop - It's OK

reviews.text: The food court was horrible! Seriously overcrowded, messy (and slow to get cleaned up) and horrendously overpriced! We found many of the staff in the food court barely competant and very rude on several occasions. We noticed many of our fellow guests had a cooler in their room for milk and juice and had brought cereals with them. If you're travelling without a car (you really don't need one if you're just going to do Disney while you stay) use the Hess gas station opposite Downtown Disney for basic groceries - it's a huge moneysaver compared to the food court!
reviews.title: We loved this place.
My Daughter won't stop talking about Pop Century!
reviews.text: We have stayed at Disney several times in the past but never in one of their 'value' resorts - if you are serious theme park junkies like us, you'll only need your room to shower and sleep and it's really not worth paying for anything better given the amount of time you'll spend in it.

Disney World is one of my favorite places in the world! I have been there 4 times however, this is my first time staying on site at Disney World. The Pop Century Resort is a pretty basic hotel, nothing fancy really. If you are planning a vacation to a Disney Resort do not expect free WiFi. In fact do not expect free internet at all! The only available internet cost $9.98/day. Disney seems to be pretty behind the times on internet access; free WiFi is common in all hotels now a days.
reviews.title: What? no WiFi!

reviews.text: Our group stayed at the Pop Century for 3 nights of our week in DisneyWorld. We booked directly through Disney, and were able to get a AAA discount...just needed to show a AAA card at check-in. The lobby was very nice, didn't have the feel of a budget hotel. We requested a preferred location (closer to food, lobby, and buses) and an adjoining room. Both requests were honored, even though we checked in around 11:00 pm. The preferred location cost a bit more, but was well worth it in my opinion. You do enough walking in the parks. The room was basic, but clean. Good water pressure, excellent temperature control, comfy beds, hair dryer. We had no trouble with noise from adjoining rooms, so that probably depends on who you get for neighbors. Also, our room was on the 4th floor, which I would recommend to avoid noise from foot traffic of people coming and going early in the morning and late at night. The food court was convenient, with enough variety to please everyone (except no hot dogs, which is a staple for my daughter). Food was OK, nothing special, and was priced like everything else at WDW. The Pop Century has a great gift shop, which made it nice to buy souveniers right at the hotel. The pools are basic, but warm with excellent lifeguards on duty. We switched mid-week to another Disney property (Boardwalk) and were very impressed with how smooth and easy this was. We dropped our bags off at the Pop luggage desk in the morning before heading to the parks and they were waiting for us at the Boardwalk at the end of the day. This was a great service by Disney and made it very easy to experience 2 different hotels. Overall, we had a positive stay at the Pop Century and I would recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Nice BASIC Disney Hotel
I love this resort
reviews.text: I have stayed here twice in Sept. and have loved it both times. I will stay here again .

reviews.title: Not too shabby!!!
reviews.text: My husband, son and I travelled from Sept 17-27 with 6 other members of our family to take a trip to Walt Disney World. I won't go into too much detail about this hotel. There is not a whole lot to tell. We did not have any problems but our stay was just OK. Let me get into it:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: GOOD:
reviews.title: Bed Bugs!!

reviews.text: This was our first time as a family going to Disney, and I would have to say that it coulod not be more perfect. We were welcomed from the very start. When we arrived there was plenty of things for the kids to do while we were checking in. Check in was a breeze. We found our room to be nothing less than perfect. The staff were all very kind and helpful.
reviews.title: Truly Heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first day at Magic Kingdom I lost my Identification and did not know until the next morning. I went ot the conseirge desk the next morning to ask for help they were very concerned. THe Lady was helpful and gave me great comfort. They even started the process to help me get home, because I had lost my licens and had no identifycation for my return flight home. They gave me great comfort. When I did find my lost item and returned to the desk to let them know they were almost as happy as I was.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: We found the rooms to be quite comfortable and quiet. We thought that the rooms were clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Pools, but Worst Coffee Ever

reviews.text: I recently visited Disney's Pop Century Resort in September 2008. I traveled with my boyfriend and we do not have any children. We were afraid at first that the hotel would be all kids and families but once we got their we had an amazing time! You dont need kids to stay at the Pop Century!
reviews.title: Mixed feelings.......you get what you pay for here

reviews.text: Hotel Room: The room itself was pretty standard. A bed, TV, Table and chairs and a bathroom. It wasnt luxurious but it did the job. The bed was fine and the cleaning staff was great. If you didnt have you room cleaned the staff would leave a bag of towels and blankets for you. As far as the room I thought it was perfect for people who were going to spend their day at the parks or pool.
reviews.title: Pop Century Gets My Vote

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the pop century in may of 2005. We stayed near the bowling pin pool. The room was very clean and we had a refrigerator in the room. The pool was clean and was open very late which was refreshing after 12 hours in a theme park. The people who worked in the food court were extremely friendly and courteous. the food was just ok though, and it seemed to me there was an odor in the main lobby building that was a mixture of cookies, pizza, and salami? I couldnt stay in there too long, but all in all it was a decent place to stay for a budget traveler. Next time I am bumping up a notch to the port orleans or something on the boat line to the restaurants.
reviews.title: Good Value for the Money

reviews.text: Stayed at the Pop for the first time. We live in Florida and have stayed in all of the moderate resorts and I would stack the Pop up to any of them (especially for the price). The rooms and grounds were spotless and looked brand new. The staff was very nice. Pay the extra for the preferred room and you will be close to transportation, pool and food area. When we return we will stay at the Pop. What a great value....
reviews.title: Love The Pop
Loved it all of it!!
reviews.text: I went to Disney with my son and family. We all enjoyed our stay in the pop centery resort it was incredibly clean considering all the people that were in the buildings. We found the staff friendly and certious. Yes the rooms are standard however with that being said who goes to Disney to stay in there room?

We purchased thier meal plan so food prices were not an issue for us, however if you should decide to buy the plan you should get some information on it, as it can be a little confusing as to what is a snack and what is a table service etc....the meal plan is definitly worth it just ask the staff what the differently things are.
reviews.title: Very reasonable for the price

reviews.text: I would stay there again, my son loved it! there was lots for kids to do in a safe family atmosphere!!
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights. 2 adults & 2 kids. This resort is nicely managed. Building, sidewalk, and every place is so clean like their theme parks. The room fits right for 4 persons just for overnight sleep. Except for a little faucet problem, we do not have any other issue.
reviews.title: Good place to sleep

reviews.text: I will stay there again next time.
reviews.title: Great Disney Vacation

reviews.text: We stayed at the Disney Pop Century Resort from 10-27-07 to 11-02-07. The hotel was really a nice get away for our family. Husband, wife and 2 daughters, ages 9 and 5. The room was a bit small but very managable. We really did not spend a lot of time there as we were at the parks all the time. There were 2 twin beds and a bathroom. The resort had 3 pools and we didn't get to take advantage of them much, but the water in them was warm, they heat the pools. The cafeteria was really busy. I recommend getting a cup to get free refills there for your entire stay for about 11 dollars.
reviews.title: Great Disney Hotel for a good price!

likes.liked: — It was Disnry charm without the high price
likes.disliked: — I liek a room that opens up to a hall way not the outside, but really, it was not that big of a deal.

reviews.text: The hotel allowed you to check your luggage and get your boarding passes right there if you were flying on certain airlines which was a big help!
reviews.title: Great Disney Value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was great for a good price, as we know Disney hotels can be very expensive, I have stayed at ALOT of Disney hotels from Value resorts to high priced Hotels and I would certainly say this was the best value resort I stayed at. I have stayed at All Star resort and did not like it was much as the Pop Century, the layout was better and the food court had a better selection. Lots of fun, the room was a good size for a family of four (just try to keep the room neat and there is plenty of room) ....it was great! ALSO! The pools were very large and heated!I would certainly advise families on a budget to stay here and still get the Disney treatment. :)
reviews.title: It was really nice

reviews.text: This was our third visit to Pop and loved it once again. We requested a room in the 50's with a view of Epcot fireworks and the lake, this was no problem. The grounds are beautiful and seem to be washed early every morning. Rooms are basic but big enough for the 3 of us. Lots of towels, face cloths,mickey soap, shampoo, tissues, iron and board, and hair dryer. If you need any more then just ring housekeeping and they deliver straight away. The view we had was amazing, the lake and we could see fireworks from Epcot and Magic Kingdom. The morning and evening duck parade was a delight, although they can be agressive when being fed!
reviews.title: Our Long Awaited Return To Pop Century

likes.disliked: — Food in the evening was limited

reviews.text: Pools are very clean and heated. The life guards are very vigilant. You have to take towels down with you but these are easily replaced.
reviews.title: We just loved the Pop Century

likes.disliked: — The walking distance to the foodcourt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used the laundrette a couple of times, I send my hubby to the laundrette on the last day while I pack so I don't get home with lots of laundry to do. The washers take 8 quarters, 4 quarters for powder and another 8 quarters for the dryer. About 30 mins for the washers and 35 minutes for the dryer.
reviews.title: Stay at a moderate resort instead
Good Overall
reviews.text: The gift shop has a good selection of disney goods. The food court can get a bit repetitive, more so at night. The breakfast is good, try the ham and cheese omelette, yummy and quite cheap.
As people have mentioned before the disney mugs are a must.
reviews.title: Great for the money and family on the go

likes.liked: — Clean, easy access to the buses from the 50s building
likes.disliked: — Small room, could hear some noise from others

reviews.text: I just Graduated this past summer from F.H. Moody H.S. in TX and i grew up with Disney in my youth when i use to live in California; This was the best Birthday present ever. I have enjoyed the experience.
reviews.title: Grad present and Birthday Preset

likes.liked: — The Overall Trip I love Diseny
likes.disliked: — The pool area some Gentlement should not be in public view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first plane ride in my life was a rememorable one to this Great resort; the Transportation to the resort was very comfortable; The room was nice a little consirnded about the mold spot on my pillow but i left the pillow out and it was replaced the next day (2); Transportation to and from the parks was a little packed but hey you can complain for staying at the Newest Vale resort; The walking is a lot but i got my exercise; The ice machine on our floor was out of order but i found one upstairs or downstairs so that wass fine.
reviews.title: Where is the Disney Magic?

reviews.text: I enjoyed the Pluto on my window seal; Pizza was as good as my moms; The Staff were nice especially on my b-day i was greeed by all Disney Staff and Cast-Members.
reviews.title: Pop was just OK

reviews.text: Overall me not paying for anything except Souviners the best trip of my life. I will be back with a friend from school whos Disenyland trip was trashed by our Music Director, so he can experiance the True Diseny Experiance.
reviews.title: Pop Century Needs a change

likes.liked: — It was on the WDW property
likes.disliked: — The cleanliness and helpfulness of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I returned this week from our third visit to the Pop Century. I made the reservation months in advance, and I requested a preferred location room with a king size bed. My request was not honored, and even the front desk was kind of surprised about the mix up. We finally wound up with a room at the end of the 70's building, with a kind size bed after three tries. The room was very basic, and we were fine with that. What did bother me was the mold in the bathroom. The sink had NO water pressure! It was difficult to brush my teeth, let alone wash my face. Since the room could be used as a connecting room, I think that the door had something to do with being able to hear the conversations of the people in the room next to us.
reviews.title: Brilliant holiday on a budget!

likes.liked: — Clean, Spacious for two and Cheap
likes.disliked: — You can only refill your drinks cups in the food hall

reviews.text: My family stayed here for a week, all 13 of us. I thought it was going to be a corny place to stay but it was very nice and fun. The pool is very nice. We went in almost everyday in the middle of the day as a break from the heat. The staff does the twist at the food court for breakfast in the morning and you get a pin if they see you joining in. Very fun! The food was good and very unique. We bought mugs to refill whenever we were thirsty and that worked very nicely. The arcade is cool. The rooms were nice and clean. Also, staying on property affords tons of benefits. Bus service, parking, access to other hotels and packages purchased in parks can be picked up at your hotel. I love Disney and now I can see it doesn't matter what hotel you stay at because they are all fantastic. I would stay here again because it is cheaper than others and it is DISNEY!!!
reviews.title: Thought I was going to be upset but definitely wasn't!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Pop Century and the Wilderness Lodge on this trip. I wanted to try a few of the onsight properties. The Pop Century was very reasonably priced, less than $100 average so to be on property for that little money was a great advantage. The check-in was a bit of a long line and that theme seemed to continue for most of the stay. i.e. the line at the bus stop for the theme parks, etc... everything moved fairly quickly, so just bring your patience. We stayed over New Years' Eve, New Year's Day, so I'm sure the lines were even longer than normal. We were in the 50's near the pool. The room felt a little small compared to other hotels (we had done a tour of hotels since we drove down from Michigan and I think even a room at the Hampton Inn was a bit larger.) The bathroom was a bit small too but functional and clean. Ask for a room on the second floor or higher, otherwise you'll get a lot of foot traffic passing your room. This hotel was a great option since we were in the parks way more than we were in the room. Think of it like a crusie ship and you'll be fine. Also, walk around to the other decade buildings. Some of the designs are quite fun, there was an outdoor game of Twister, a giant Big Wheel, other fun stuff for young kids. If you want value, stay here. If you want deluxe and service and plan to stay more in your room or in the lodge, go to the Wilderness.
reviews.title: Great Value, Rooms A Bit Small

reviews.text: We stayed Dec 3-9 and had a good time. We've stayed on site several times and Pop Century is definately the best of the bargain priced hotels. It seemed cleaner than the others and the walkway around the lake is a nice way to wind down in the evening. Buses were brutal but all buses were having issues this week...I don't think they were expecting the crowds and at least at Pop you didn't have to share a bus with any other hotel (like the all stars). We upgraded to be closer to the buses (can't remember what that was called) so we were by the main pool and I liked that. They have gotten rid of those horrible soap things in the bathrooms and went back to giving you the Mickey soap and shampoo. The food was typical Disney (not great, not bad, although at the first fast food on the right if you are facing the coolers...they had a "mom's night out special" that was pretty good.) and don't forget to buy your mug on the first day for the all you can drink sodas, coffee and icees. It was a nice option if you're on a budget.
reviews.title: Best of the Bargain Priced hotels

reviews.text: Have visited WDW several times and think you can really make the most of your holiday by staying on property. If you're not into using the spa facilities etc that are available at the better hotels you really can't go wrong with pop century. Rooms are clean and the housekeeping team do a great job, although if you ever do want a lie in you'll need to use the 'do not disturb' card as they get to the rooms pretty early. Have read that a lot of people had trouble with noise outside the rooms. I didn't notice this at all, but I am quite a heavy sleeper.
reviews.title: Great base for the parks
Good Hotel - If you don't like to sleep late
reviews.text: Food was good, I was travelling with a vegetarian and people were very helpful about adjusting the menus to suit her. I would concur with other reviews here that the food court is very pricey for what it is. Most dining on Disney property I found to be expensive compared to dining out in the 'real' world.

We stayed at the Pop Century for 3 nights at the end of February and enjoyed it. As all other reviews will tell you, the rooms ARE small, have LITTLE counter space, but are clean. As for noise, we could hear the plumbing in the room next door as well as children yelling and running in the walkway outside the door. We could not, however, hear any voices or televisions from adjoining rooms. Rooms include a hair-dryer, safe, ironing board, iron, tv, and phone.
reviews.title: Will probably return

reviews.text: Service at WDW is great. We landed at MCO at around 6 AM, hopped on an empty Magical Express bus within minutes, and were at Pop Century about 30 minutes later. Although check-in was not until 3 PM, we were given room keys and allowed in our room at 7AM. When we got to our room, we quickly discovered that our sink was backed up. We called housekeeping and they had the sink fixed by the time we got back to our room that evening. The morning of our departure, resort staff hung an envelope on our door that included our airline boarding passes and Magical Express info.
reviews.title: Very Nice, but know what your getting into

reviews.text: Food at Pop is limited to the counter-service cafeteria/food court. The food isn't bad. Make sure to buy one of their refillable mugs: $13 buys you unlimited refills at Pop for the length of your stay. Refills, however, are not available at the parks. Still, it makes it very convenient to grab coffee in the morning and drink it on the way to the parks.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.text: If you don't mind a little bit of noise, the best rooms are probably on the ground floor of the 60's building, facing the pool. Here, you'll have easy access to the pool, the food court, lobby, and buses.
reviews.title: Honest Review - Loved the Hotel - A+ for what it is!

likes.liked: — The accessibility and everything was met with a smile - very comfortable
likes.disliked: — Nothing - absolutely nothing! Maybe, the restaurant being open a bit later - but that is being really picky!

reviews.text: You could stay off-property for a bit less money, but we personally felt that the attention to details and Disney treatment made up for the higher price.
reviews.title: Loved the Pop Century

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at Pop Century. At a very reasonable AAA rate, we received more value that expected for the price. Our request for a specific building location (1950s) and 4th floor was honored. Although the room was small, for the 2 of us it was adequate. We found the room clean. However, the bath towels are very small and thin. The grounds are well kept and the building colors were very "bright".
reviews.title: 2nd time still a charm!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We provided our own holiday window decorations and the staff added wash cloths shaped and decorated like animals. This was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: A refrigerator is not included in tthe room although one is available for a fee. (We always travel with a cooler when staying at a budget hotel room and, with adequate ice available, our "cold" goods remained cold in our cooler.
reviews.title: Not Very MAGICAL

reviews.text: The food court is a little pricey but the food quantity and quality was adequate.
reviews.title: Stressful enviroment

likes.liked: — Transportation System, though this is also available at other Disney Resorts.

reviews.text: Staying on resort property provided free parking at Disney theme parks, a savings of $11/day.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Long lines everywhere!
reviews.text: I should have known when we waited 45 minutes in the check-in line that it was going to be this way. The staff was courteous and the hotel is very clean and decorated famously. But after an exhausting day at Epcot a 60 minute wait for the bus was more than any of us could handle. (I doubt that this was typical. The buses take an exceedingly long time to load if there are wheelchair riders.) We stayed at Pop Century because the kids had begged and begged but really, you get much more for you money off Disney property. If you fly into Orlando and don't want to rent a car, this is a good hotel. If you have a car, it's not worth the hassle.

reviews.title: Kids Loved it!(Mom and Dad did too!)
reviews.text: 5/18--5/25 Pop Century was great. As you may or may not know, when you're in Disney, you're always on the go. The cafeteria/restaurant was great for us because we could get up early, have a decent meal and run, or swim or just cool of in the sprinklers before hopping on our bus which picked us up right in front of the main building. At night, the kids loved shopping at the Disney Store, getting a quick snack, and swimming late. But mostly swiiming late. We will never forget our trip. Thanks Pop Century for being a BIG part of our fun.

reviews.title: Best Place to Stay on the Cheap
reviews.text: Much better alternative than the All Star Resorts. It's closer to the parks and the busses are a lot less of a hassle. Since it's newer, it seems cleanier (not like All Stars are dirty though) and the services are a bit more customer friendly. More than worth the price.

reviews.title: Such a fun place!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pop Century May 26-29, and just loved it! Our room in the 60's was a short distance from transportation, the pool, lobby, and food court. A neat thing to get is a refillable mug. It's great because you have a variety of choices to drink ( slushies, coffee, sodas...etc) and pay one price for your entire stay. Well worth it. The staff is extremly friendly and helpful- the maps they give you at check-in are great! Also the beds are really comfertable, you'll want to take the pillows home with you! If you want a great value, but still a lot of whimsy this is a great place to stay.

reviews.title: Don't hesitate to stay at the Pop
reviews.text: My family and I just returned from spending 6 nights (May 26 - June 1) at the Pop Century and we were very satisfied. The rooms are not huge and you can hear some noise from the next rooms, but after a looooong day at the parks, how big does your room really need to be???
My husband, my 10 yr old daughter and I stayed at this hotel from the 15th of June to 29th June 2006, only back 6 days and we all wish we were still there.
reviews.title: Fantastic
Loved the flower show at Epcot
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel around about 5.30pm, very tired after our 10 hour flight, although for all you brits out there, I know there has been a lot of talk about the amount of time it takes to go through security at the airport, but honestly don't worry. When you first get off the plane, the queues look massive but we could not believe just how quickly and effciently they dealt with this. in fact we had more problems leaving than we did arriving due to being 24kg over our baggage allowance and I then set of the alarms by forgetting to remove my cell phone from my pocket. LoL

reviews.title: Great Disney Budget Hotel
reviews.text: Checking in - an absolute breeze, plenty of staff, checked in within minutes. Also had our disney passes that we had bought in the Uk transfered to our room key and our credit card was added as well. This proved to be a very convienient way to pay for meals, snacks and gifts from either the hotel or the parks. We also bought a lanyard each so we could have easy access to the key/pass etc.

reviews.title: Next time I'd pass
reviews.text: Building - We stayed in the eighties/nineties section on the fourth floor, which faced onto the computer pool. We had no problems finding a parking space, in fact we had no problems with parking for our entire 2 week trip.

The room - I did not find the rooms to be tiny like some of the reviews I had read prior to our trip and it was very clean, ok the furishings are pretty basic, but functional. In your room you will find an iron and an ironing board, and there is a hairdryer in the little vanity area beside the bathroom. The beds are ok size and neither of us had any problems what so ever falling asleep as the beds were quite comfortable and the pillows were nice an fluffy. As for the noise levels from either the pool or the people in adjacent rooms, I don't understand how people can say they could hear entire conversations because of the thin walls, We certainly did not find this to be true, occasionally we heard the odd child screaming and the odd raised voice, but then again small children will get over excited or tired which normally accounts for the raised voice from the worn out parent. but it was only ever the odd word or so, and unless I had my ear up against the wall I could certainly not hear anybodies conversations ever. Which I was quite disapointed with actually as I had been looking forward to it (so my husband says). The same could be said about the pool noise, yes you can hear it and yes some kids are still swimming till 1.30am somenights, but its not overbearing and we found after being at the parks and shopping most days, once your head hits the pillow your out cold.
reviews.title: Creative and Fun resort for the whole family!

reviews.text: We stayed at Pop Century from June 25-July 1, 2006. Previously we stayed at Coronado, Caribbean, and Animal Kingdom Lodge. All four members of my family agree---it's worth it to spend extra to stay at a moderate resort at least. We definitely won't go back to Pop. First, the public areas aren't as clean at Pop Century, especially at the food court, which was often very crowded. Also the pools are crowded, yet boring---no water slide, no hot tub, no deeper portions for swimming. The bus transportation isn't adequate. With all the people staying at Pop, you'd think the buses would come every 10 minutes, instead of 20. Mostly we had to stand on the buses that served Pop. On one night, coming back from MGM, we came upon about 500 people in line waiting for a bus. By the time we got on a bus, the line still had 500 behind us (Pop is bus stop #10 at MGM---the line stretched back past bus stop #7). When we talked about this with a bus driver the next day, he said Disney was short 150 bus drivers. Finally, our non-smoking room reeked of smoke on a number of occasions. We didn't have confidence our problem could be reconciled---we dealt with it by keeping the fan in the bathroom running.
reviews.title: Won't stay at Pop again
Great July 4th Weekend at Disney
reviews.text: Maybe we were spoiled on our last visit in Aug 2004---we had a great deal for the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The atmosphere, service, food, rooms, pool, bus transportation, activities, shopping area are so much better. Its worth waiting for a discounted rate for a place like Animal Kingdom before going back to Disney to stay at a place like Pop. The theme parks can wear you out---it's no fun to come back to a resort that can wear you out as well.

reviews.title: Great time at POP
reviews.text: You can't please everyone all the time, but I do feel like Disney tries. This hotel is Disney's version of a Holiday Inn (along with the All Star Resorts). If that's what you expect going in, you'll be fine. If you expect a Hilton, Park Plaza or Ritz, go to one of the more expensive Disney properties. That being said, the hotel was better than expected. My girlfriend and I requested a preferred room with a king size bed and Disney delivered. We were in the 60's building overlooking the pool. The pool was always crowded and people went in at night but we rarely heard much from our room on the 3rd floor. We also never heard a peep from the surrounding rooms so sound insulation is good. If you're worried about pool noise, get a room that doesn't face the pool and you'll be fine. The bed was comfy and the pillows aren't what I have at home but they did just fine. The room was very clean as was the bathroom. Word of advice: use the privacy sign if you stay in your room in the early mornings. Disney apparently assumes most people go to the parks early and come cleaning around 9/10am. We like to sleep in and quickly learned to use the sign the first morning! Also around 10am the happy music plays from the speakers around the pool. If you're in the parks, no problem but if it would bother you (didn't bother us) stay at a room facing a courtyard. We only ate at the hotel once and it was fine. It's pretty much a self-serve cafeteria so you need to grab a table first and get the food one at a time. Think of your college food court or inside a fast food place. Bottom line on the hotel: I'd stay here again and would recommend to anyone coming to Disney on a budget. If you have money to spare, the other Disney resorts can be very nice (just depends on what your tastes are and pocketbook allows).
From the reviews below people like to include the Disney parks, etc along with the hotel review (which I feel should be two separate reviews) so I'll include my experiences as well.
reviews.title: It did the job...

reviews.text: Transportation: It varies. Every 10 mins or so was our experience on waiting on the busses, sometimes even quicker. Leaving Magic Kingdom at night they had an army of busses so the wait was about 5mins. When I go on vacation I hate to drive so if you’re like me, this is the way to go. No complaints.
reviews.title: Would do it again
I love this hotel!
reviews.text: with and without kids) The rooms were clean and the staff has always been great. Every evening upon returning from the parks the housekeepers had made animals and toothbrush holders out of the towels and arranged the kids stuffed animals in the room or in the windows. The flowers pool has a great kids water play area.

reviews.title: Loved the Pop Century
reviews.text: We stayed down at the Disney's Pop Century and LOVED IT!!!! We are two 23 year old women who went down to have a little fun and relax in the sun. We were able to hang out by the pool during the day while enjoying our unlimited refreshments as well as having plenty to do at night with the Marketplace and Pleasure Island. IT is defenitely somewhere I would love to visit again soon.

I just came back from my vacation in Orlando. I loved the Pop Century Resort. The rooms are a bit small but not a big deal. The food is very reasonably priced and tastes great. Lots to choose from. The pools are clean and heated. The rooms are clean. The area is fun to look at. The resort offers airline check in for you and your baggage. I was able to check into my flight early in the morning, they took my bags for me and I hit another park for the day and went straight to the airport - no worries at all. Definitely plan to stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved Resort - Had a great time!

reviews.text: I think perhaps we were expecting too much from the glowing reviews that we read for the Pop.
reviews.title: Pleasant but not as good as we expected

reviews.text: The good: Well kept grounds with a fun theme. Clean rooms. Friendly front desk folks. Good variety of food at the food court.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for a quick stay at Disney - 1/13/06-1/16/06
Great price and convenience for adults and lots of fun for kids
reviews.text: Pop Century is the newest value hotel on Disney property, opening in Dec./2003. For the amount of time we actually spent in the room, it was perfect. Very comfortable, clean and new. Separate sink from the toilet/shower was a time-saver for three people rushing to get to the theme parks. Long operating hours on the three pools were great for the kids. Classic Hall is the main building where you check-in and had everything else we needed from luggage carts, to a video game room, to a Disney store, to a food court, to a wall of memorabilia. Food variety and quality were great at a reasonable price. Service was great. Buses also at Classic Hall to take you to the theme parks. Overall, a very well designed and layed out hotel. Parking seemed a little far from the rooms, but with Disney transportation, who needs a car?

reviews.title: a stay in Gigantic proportion!!!
reviews.text: For the price, quality, and convenience, I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

my kids and i stayed at "pop century" and all my kids could say was...."WOW" they and i loved everything about it, all of the cast members were fantastic! we were treated like royalty, and since i was traveling alone with small kids everyone was right there to help out, i highly recomend "pop century" to every family, not only was the price right, the pools and attractions were beyond wonderful! my kids now want to have a bowling pin shaped pool!! lol!! we plan on coming back in a few years and "pop century" is where we'll stay. thanks again to all the staff members for a very relaxing time and for all of your help when needed!
reviews.title: Loved it! It was the perfect vacation!
Loved Pop Century!!!
reviews.text: We just got back from our trip a few weeks ago. Pop Century was great! 3 pools, a kiddie zero depth pool (with fountains) and a food court. The food was ok - standard cafeteria style but pricey. Get out for at least one meal somewhere else. I suggest buying the drink cups for $12 since it would cost you a small fortune to buy them individually. The shuttle buses were very convenient and came often. We rarely waited for more than 10 minutes. This is one of the reasons we decided to stay on-sight. We had a room overlooking the the lake and at night we could see the fireworks from Disney World. It was very quiet on that side of the motel away from the pools. The room are standard, nothing fancy. Besides, you're really only in your room to sleep. Watch out if you want a fridge in your room. It is $10 per day! We thought it was $10 total. Since they misquoted us, they only charged us the $10. Great time, highly recommended.

reviews.title: We had the best time at Pop Century
reviews.text: WOW! Just back from a 6 night stay at Pop Century, it beat all of our expectations. We were given an excellent room in the 50's section upon our early check-in, very close to "Everything Pop" and overlooking the pool. Noise level was just fine at this resort- no problems there. The rooms weren't as small as we had expected after reading reviews, we even had a crib in the room for our infant and there was plenty of room.

We were very impressed with Pop Century. After reading all of the negative reviews, we were a bit concerned. Yes, it is a big resort but that is what Disney is all about (the bigger the better). There may be some long walks but relax and enjoy the scenery. It is a beautiful resort. The pool areas were great. The bowling pin pool was by far the warmest pool even though they will tell you that the water temperature is all the same. The lobby and food court areas were very impressive. The lines were long in the food court, but they will get you through quickly. The nostalgic icons used around the resort brought back many fond memories. The rooms were not large, but they were very accomodating. Our room was very clean. The only complaint that we have concerning the resort is that the walls are very thin. You will be able to hear people walking and talking outside. Other than that, we had a great experience at Pop Century and would definately go back. We have stayed at the moderate resorts before, and we rank this resort right up there with them, especially for the price.
reviews.title: Very Impressed!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Just returned from 10 nights at Pop Century (3 - 13 Feb) 2 Adults and 2 children (8 and 5). Having read many reviews on here I requested a room in the 60s block and was delighted when we got a room there with a room overlooking the lake, it was nice and quiet yet only a few minutes from our pool the Hippy Dippy flower shaped one and the main building. The 50's block with the skittle pool isn't too far away but the other blocks would have been quite a walk for my 5 year old after a day of walking around the parks.
reviews.title: Fantastic Fun

likes.liked: — Fun, colourful, the icons, the pools and cleanliness (wild life, saw ducks and rabbits)

reviews.text: The refillable cups are a must buy as soon as you arrive with an endless supply of tea/coffee/hot chocolate/fizzy drinks/apple juice. Also free small cartons of milk which we used on the cereal and plenty of jams/honey etc. The food court was busy at peak times, we sat by the pool at breakfast or if it was too busy in the court we would get breakfast at the park. Choice of cereals, bread for toasting (even a loaf for sale if a big party), pastries and fruit, all available from the market area of the court so only had to queue to pay. Ate a couple of evenings as well and found the pasta and pizzas great.
reviews.title: Not impressed

likes.disliked: — it was just too big you had to walk very far to get to everything the pool our car and the food court

reviews.title: Will DEFINATELY return!!
reviews.text: The pool area was superb, spotlessly clean, great life guards and plenty of sunbeds and the pool was a lovely temperature. Hard to drag the children away. We loved all the icons around the complex, the maintenance were on the ball and painting one of the big yo yos whilst we were there.

The rooms are a bit dated but comfortable, nice mickey toiletries and fantastic shower. Found the transportation excellent, best to avoid busiest times but even one night when we left MK after fireworks and the queue was huge for PC, 5 buses turned up in 10 minutes, brill.
reviews.title: Disney Motel-

description: Disney's Pop Century Resort is a Disney Value Resort hotel featuring giant icons that salute many of the 20th-century popular culture crazes—including toys, gadgets, music, movies, fads and catch phrases.
